Manual page for CONTROL(PL)

#control attribute value

DESCRIPTION

Set various operational modes. Note: This is part of the general script processing package and has little use in the ploticus context.

ATTRIBUTES

attribute may be one of:

evalvars

value should be no to turn off evaluation of variables and yes to turn it on. Default is yes.

dot_in_varnames

If value is yes, variable names may contain periods (.). If value is no, period will be used as a delimiting character when scanning variable names in the script, and variable names cannot contain any periods. The default is no unless sql database functionality is included in which case the default is yes (since sql join result field names contain periods).

suppressdll

value should be yes to suppress data-less lines, and no to show data-less lines. Default is no. A data-less line is a line having one or more variables, all of which evaluate to a zero-length value. Suppressing data-less lines is sometimes useful, for example, when displaying multi-line entities such as postal addresses.





data display engine
